meanings.definition: A name used by an author instead of their real name.
meanings.sent1: The author chose a penname to keep their identity a secret.
meanings.sent2: She published her book under a penname to appeal to a wider audience.
meanings.sent3: The mysterious penname on the book cover intrigued readers.
meanings.sent4: The penname acted as a shield, allowing the author to explore different genres freely.
meanings.sent5: The penname 'Silver Quill' sparkled with creativity and imagination.

meanings.sent1: The famous author decided to penname his next novel for a change.
meanings.sent2: She pennamed her articles to explore diverse writing styles.
meanings.sent3: He pennamed his grocery list to make shopping more exciting.
meanings.sent4: The poet pennamed her emotions, turning them into beautiful verses.
meanings.sent5: To penname is to dance with words in disguise, revealing truths in shadows.
